==History==
==History==
[[File:Musical Performance in Oscar Grant Plaza Amphitheater.jpg|thumb|The plaza amphitheater]]
[[File:Musical Performance in Oscar Grant Plaza Amphitheater.jpg|thumb|The plaza amphitheater]]
â
* 1914, City Hall constructed.
+
* 1896, the San Francisco Chronicle reported on a young Jack London giving speeches in the park. <ref>"Jack London, who is known as the boy socialist of Oakland, is holding forth nightly to the crowds that throng City Hall Park. There are other speakers in plenty, but London always gets the biggest crowd and the most respectful attention. the young man is a pleasant speaker, more earnest than eloquent, and while he is a broad socialist in every way, he is not an anarchist"</ref>
  +
* 1914, modern City Hall completed.
* [[1989 Loma Prieta earthquake]] damages buildings throughout the region. The city hall is evacuated after being damaged in the quake.
* [[1989 Loma Prieta earthquake]] damages buildings throughout the region. The city hall is evacuated after being damaged in the quake.
* 1998 marked the completion of the renovated plaza.
* 1998 marked the completion of the renovated plaza.
